data.title: Newark Airport Terminals Guide
data.meta_description: View our guide to the Newark Airport terminals for information about EWR’s terminals, airlines, parking, restaurants, shops, and so much more.
data.text:
About Newark International Airport

On October 1, 1928, Newark Liberty International Airport began serving the New York Metropolitan area. Located in Newark, New Jersey, EWR provides access to thirty major airlines. Newark International is one of the three airports that serve the New York/New Jersey area. Each year, over 42 million passengers fly out of EWR.

Used for military operations during the second world war, Newark International Airport reopened for commercial use in 1964 under the Port Authority of New York. Between 1964 and 1990, EWR grew exponentially. Additions to the airport included rental car facilities, two terminals, a rail system, and countless amenities to make travel convenient for air passengers.

EWR is one of United Airlines’ largest hubs and this bustling airport is steeped in American history. On September 11, 2001, a United Airlines flight left EWR and never reached its final destination. The hijacked plane crashed in Pennsylvania and left no survivors. “Liberty” was added to the airport’s name to honor the victims of the tragic events of 9/11.

More Information About Terminal A

Newark Airport’s Terminal A is designated for domestic and regional flights. It has three concourses, A1, A2, and A3 and is the oldest of the three Newark Airport terminals. Because the terminal has three concourses, passengers must reenter security if they are connecting to a flight leaving from a different concourse. Terminal A features four levels that house restaurants, kiosks, shops, and the gate area.

Terminal A hosts a wide selection of places to eat, drink, and shop. Free wifi is available throughout the terminal so travelers can work, browse social media, or check on flight updates while they wait. Each concourse features a lounge where passengers can escape the crowds and relax including the Air Canada Maple Leaf Lounge in concourse A1, the United Club Lounge in concourse A2, and the American Admirals Club Lounge in concourse A3.

Restaurants / Bars In Terminal A

Terminal A offers ample places to dine before and after security checkpoints. Grab and go eats are available if you are in a hurry. If you want to sit down and enjoy a meal, there are several restaurants waiting to serve hungry travelers. From pizza to seafood, Terminal A has a varied selection of eateries to suit all taste buds. Coffee and snacks are also available for passengers looking for a pick me up before boarding.

AirTrain Newark Prices

The AirTrain is free to passengers traveling between the Newark Airport terminals. Outside of the airport, tickets are just $7.75*. Children under 11 can ride the AirTrain for free. Be sure to keep your ticket with you, as you’ll need to show it twice. You will be asked to show your ticket when you go through the fare line at EWR. Weekly and monthly tickets are available, and they can be purchased at the ticket stations located throughout Newark International Airport.

Security and Customs at Newark Airport

Each of the Newark Airport terminals has three security checkpoints and customs can be found in Terminals B and C. Out of the nine security checkpoints including all of Terminal A’s checkpoints and checkpoint B1 in Terminal B have designated TSA PreCheck lanes. Frequent flyers can sign up for TSA PreCheck at the enrollment center in Terminal C to save time when flying.

Global Entry kiosks for international passengers are located in Terminals B and C for those who have been cleared. Individuals needing an interview or wishing to enroll can do so in Terminals B and C. Mobile Passport Control is available at EWR to help eligible passengers travel smoothly through customs.

Additional Services at Newark Airport

Each of the Newark Airport terminals offers a variety of additional services to ensure the comfort and safety of EWR travelers. Traveler’s Aid is available to passengers who need help with missed flights or lost luggage. Children’s play areas and baby facilities provide a family-friendly space to wait for flights. Pet owners and travelers with service animals can take their pets to the relief stations.

Duty-free shops allow travelers to purchase items without paying tax, and there are ample currency exchange stations in each of the Newark Airport terminals. In Terminal C, the interfaith chapel offers a place for travelers to pray and engage in their spiritual practices. While luggage storage is not available at this time, skycaps are available to help with baggage loading and unloading to make EWR more accessible. Designated smoking areas are located outside of the terminals.

24/7 Shuttle Service

When you park at Newark Airport Long Term Parking, you will be dropped off at EWR by one of our professional drivers. Our shuttle service to and from the airport is included in each reservation, and we strive to make the ride to and from the airport enjoyable and convenient. Your shuttle driver will load and unload your luggage for you, so you won’t have to lift a finger. Our shuttles run 24/7 to accommodate all arriving and departing travelers.

Pickup By Text

Pickup by text is offered to help our customers save time when traveling from EWR. When you opt to use this service, you’ll receive a claim check with our phone number on it before you leave. When you arrive back at EWR, simply text us your check number and terminal letter, and we will immediately send a driver out to pick you up.

Electric Charging Stations

Travelers with electric vehicles can enjoy the convenience of electric charging stations located at our secure offsite Newark Airport parking facility. If you want us to charge your vehicle while you are away, book a parking reservation and upon request one of our staff members will hook your car up to a EV charging station. You’ll return home knowing that your vehicle is charged and ready to go.

Complimentary Luggage Handling

Newark Airport Long Term Parking offers complimentary luggage handling to make travel easier for all of our customers. We’ll load and unload your luggage when you are boarding the shuttle and when we drop you off at your terminal. We want to make your trip as stress-free as possible, so we will do the heavy lifting for you while you enjoy the ride.
